body_html:
however, if the user receives a batch that isn't a tensor, it would raise another exception later when feeding to the model, so this isn't a problem that will silently pass.

Our worry is that this error might or might not be silent depending on the model structure (it could be a user-defined model) so we're erring on the side of less side effects.
body_text:
however, if the user receives a batch that isn't a tensor, it would raise another exception later when feeding to the model, so this isn't a problem that will silently pass.

Our worry is that this error might or might not be silent depending on the model structure (it could be a user-defined model) so we're erring on the side of less side effects.
body:
> however, if the user receives a batch that isn't a tensor, it would raise another exception later when feeding to the model, so this isn't a problem that will silently pass. 

Our worry is that this error might or might not be silent depending on the model structure (it could be a user-defined model) so we're erring on the side of less side effects.
